entry.title: üìÖ Schedule
entry.content:
Wedding

8 January

Traditional Vietnamese Ceremony

In the early morning we will hold a traditional Vietnamese tea ceremony at Ha‚Äôs parents house. It usually takes place at 9 AM and ends before lunch time.

Reception

We will hold a reception in the afternoon. The whole ceremony will occur from probably 5 PM to 9 PM. The first hour is for welcome drinks and finger food. In a traditional Vietnamese wedding that Ha vividly remembers, people usually start having the first course at 6:30 PM and finish the last course at 9 PM.

After Party

Yes yes, it‚Äôs party time.

Tour

9 January

Streetfood Tour

Say what now? A food tour right after the ‚Äúgoing wild‚Äù night? Nja, you are on vacation! No work is going to stop you!

Supermarket

We‚Äôll visit a supermarket so people can stock up on supplies needed for the next day(s).

Da Lat

10 January

Bus trip

We‚Äôll be taking a tour bus in the morning to the beautiful mountain city of Da Lat.

The bus will take around 7 hours, we‚Äôll be leaving in the morning so don‚Äôt forget to set your alarm!

Evening

After the long bus trip it would be nice to have some food and stretch our legs, this is a great time to visit Da Lat‚Äôs famous evening market.

11 January

Morning

We start the day with a nice breakfast at the local market.

Midday

After breakfast we‚Äôll visit a mushroom-themed village, yes you heard that right.

Evening

We‚Äôll have dinner at a very nice hot-pot restauraunt with some amazing views.

12 January

Morning

The second day is the day for some local specialty breakfast. With full bellies we‚Äôll visit a Buddhist temple made from empty bottles.

Midday

The next event is a bit of a drive, so we‚Äôll bring some nice lunch. After eating a lot it‚Äôs important to stay have enough fluids in your body for proper digestion, that‚Äôs why the next event will be a tea tour.

Evening

The last evening where the big group will be together.

13 January

The great split

This is the part where most people will be going their separate ways, unless you‚Äôre going to Da Nang with us this also the part where you‚Äôll have to start booking your own itinerary. What follows are the routes people will take:

Option #1: Back home

A couple of people will be going back home by airplane with a stop in Saigon.

Option #2: Da Nang

13 January

Bus

First we‚Äôll be taking the bus to Nha Trang at 9:00. This will take 4 hours. We‚Äôll arrive around 13:00.

Nha Trang

In Nha Trang we can hang out a bit on the beach, eat some nice food and relax.

13-14 January

Train

After a relaxed day and a full stomach we‚Äôll be taking the sleeping train to wake up in Da Nang. The train will take about 10 hours.

We‚Äôll take train SE22, which leaves at 19:48 and arrives at 6:30 in the morning in Da Nang.

14-19 January

Adventure

It‚Äôs time for adventure!

19-20 January

Train

This is an optional train you can take if you decide to go back to Saigon. Thomas and Ha will take this, so if you want to join us let us know!

The train will take about 16 hours so we need to be prepared with plenty of food.

Option #3: Hoi An

19 January

Plane

Everyone going to Hoi An will be taking the plane to Da Nang.

Taxi

After landing in Da Nang people will take a taxi to Hoi An.

19-? January

Relaxing

Time to take it easy. Hang out and swim at the beach, drink a lot of cocktails, go to nice restaurants; this is why they call it holiday.

Option #4: Solo Travel

19-? January

True adventure

Fully immersing yourself in another culture and environment by throwing yourself into the unknown. Engaging with local people around you without any barriers, whilst making your own plan. This is travel in it‚Äôs purest form.

entry.title: ‚ùì FAQ
entry.content:
Frequently Asked Questions

Some questions that were asked zero or more times.

What should I do when I arrive?
  1. Walk to the check-out hall.
  2. Don‚Äôt stand immediately in the check-out queue but go to the left section where you can transfer your e-visa invitation.
  3. Buy the visa with the dollars you brought.
  4. Go to the check-out line.
  5. Buy a SIM card, and tell us your new number.
  6. Go to the ATM and get Vietnamese money.
  7. Get a taxi or walk to the hotel. Public transport is not worth the hassle. Be careful that you aren‚Äôt getting scammed with the taxi, ask the price in advance and check the meter.
What is arranged by you and what should I plan/book myself?

By us:

  • Everything we‚Äôll do in Da Lat. Including transportation and activities.
  • Transportation on the day of the wedding, we‚Äôll pick you up at the hotel and drop you of in the evening if you don‚Äôt go party afterwards.

Plan yourself:

  • When going to Da Nang afterwards: everything after the sleeping train arrives back in Saigon, this includes where you‚Äôll stay.
  • When only joining us to Da Lat: everything from the latest day in Da Lat, including all transportation.
What kind of clothes should I bring?

As little as possible! Vietnam tends to be quite hot, although it can be a bit chilly in the middle and north of the country, especially in the evening. Either way bringing too many clothes is a burden and greatly decreases the fun of moving from place to place.

For the dress code on the wedding day itself see Dress Code.

What will be the program in Da Lat?

That‚Äôs a surprise!

What will we do during the couple of days before the wedding day?

We would love to plan some activities, but due to the possibility of having to organize things for the wedding day itself we can‚Äôt commit to anything.

Can I use my non-Vietnamese SIM-card in Vietnam?

You can, although it will cost you a lot of money. It‚Äôs highly recommended to buy a SIM card with a data plan on the airport or in the city itself. These are quite cheap and give you good internet coverage almost everywhere.

Where should I get Vietnamese money?

The best place to get it is from the ATM in Vietnam. The exchange rate when getting it in your home country will be very steep. There are ATMs outside of the check-out zone in the airport.

How many people live in Saigon?

According to Wikipedia there are 8,993,082 inhabitants in the municipality in 2019 and 21,281,639 in the metropolitan area!

entry.title: üßß Wedding Gifts
entry.content:
We are not going to have a gift wishlist for our wedding like in the Western tradition since we will follow the Vietnamese tradition.

In Vietnam, people will gift the newlywed money as a way to help them pay out their wedding costs. People will put the money in the invitation envelope and give them at the reception table at the beginning of the evening ceremony. The amount of money depends on your financial status, how many people will go with you (partners, children, etc.), the current price of a restaurant meal for one person times the number of people are joining, and lastly the amount of money the (parents of) the newlywed used to gift you in your (children) wedding in the past.

For our wedding, you can just consider what feels right for yourself. We think that it‚Äôs easy for the people (not have to think of the gifts) as well as for us (not have to buy extra luggage to carry all the gifts back to the NL) if we keep the Vietnamese tradition.

entry.title: üõÉ Visa
entry.content:
E-Visa

In order to enter Vietnam, you need to be Vietnamese(duh?) or you‚Äôll need a visa. Most of the EU passport holders can apply for an e-visa, which will let you board the airplane. The e-visa is valid for only 30 days and single entry. If you want to stay longer in Vietnam, you can apply for another tourist visa, which unfortunately the government doesn‚Äôt issue for now because of the corona situation.

Applying for an e-visa can be done here.

Keep in mind that an e-visa is more like an invitation letter to let you board the plane. When you arrive at the Vietnamese airport, you will need to fill in a form and pay fees to get the visa stickers for your passport. They only accept US dollars or Vietnamese Dong for these fees and there‚Äôs no ATM, so make sure you have some on you.

Important info

Triple check the data on the e-visa application! If you enter any wrong information, and the Vietnamese embassy won‚Äôt check it for you, you will not be able to board the plane. Yes, yes. What an obvious statement we are making, don‚Äôt you think? Who the hell on Earth would fill out a visa application form with his ID number swapped with his BSN number, right??? You‚Äôll be surprised with how stupid one can be, cough Thomas cough..

Emergency Visa

It‚Äôs possible, and expensive, to get a last ‚Äúminute‚Äù visa.

They will need at least 45 minutes to issue an e-visa and keep in mind the different time zone. So, our suggestion is that coming to the airport as early as possible, so you can have enough time to fix your mistakes if you made one.

Don‚Äôt let your father-in-law wash your pants with the passport still in the pocket. cough like Thomas cough If you have a good quality passport, then okay, do as you want. But if your passport is not as good as the Dutch one, then don‚Äôt. If the visa sticker is not readable, you might not be able to get out of the country. January is the time for our Tet holidays, which means that NO EMBASSY is going to work and NO GOVERNMENT AGENCY is going to issue a new visa for you. It means that you will get stuck in Vietnam for a minimum of 3 weeks.

Help

If you need help with your visa application don‚Äôt hesitate to send us a message.

entry.title: ‚úàÔ∏è Getting There
entry.content:
Visa

There are a couple of ways to get a visa for Vietnam.

E-Visa

You can apply for an e-visa on this Vietnamese government site. It takes a couple of working days and you will have to pay 25 dollars in advance.

Don‚Äôt forget to double- or even triple-check all information on the application. The Vietnamese government doesn‚Äôt check the data you enter. If you swap your passport number with your national identification number as I did for example you‚Äôre visa will be refused at the check-in. Doing this will give you a couple of minutes, if you‚Äôre lucky, to hastily book a very expensive last-minute visa. This will create a lot of stress, not recommended.

It‚Äôs not necessary but also highly recommended to print the e-visa.

Embassy

Another, more expensive, option is to apply for a visa at the Vietnamese embassy. In the Netherlands it‚Äôs located in Den Haag and in Belgium in Brussels. This costs 77 dollars and you have to physically go there.

Third-Party Service

Another, also more expensive, option is to use a third-party service to get your visa. In the Netherlands the ANWB can be used for example.

Plane

We recommend booking the plane 6 months in advance to get a good deal.

You can fly from Amsterdam to Ho Chi Minh city with a transit flight, or drive to Frankfurt and take a direct flight.

The airline we recommend are ‚ÄúVietnam Airlines‚Äù, since they have big planes with a bit more leg space. The airlines you should avoid are ‚ÄúSwiss Airlines‚Äù and ‚ÄúEdelweiss‚Äù because the planes are small and there‚Äôs little room for your body parts. If you have Ha‚Äôs size (unlikely) it doesn‚Äôt matter which line you book.

Websites to compare and book tickets:

  • https://www.momondo.nl

Airport in Vietnam

It‚Äôs highly recommended to bring at least 25 dollars or equivalent in Vietnamese Dong to the Vietnamese airport, just in case. Something might go ‚Äúwrong‚Äù and you might have to ‚Äúpay‚Äù an official. It‚Äôs not possible to use an ATM there and they don‚Äôt accept euros.

entry.title: üåè Where To Next
entry.content:
Of course you want to see other things after (or before) the wedding. It would be a shame to spend all this time in the airplane just for a single weekend. What follows are some places that we recommend visiting.

Vietnam is indeed a long country with diverse types of nature. Before diving into the details, it‚Äôs probably nice to first get to know the country as a whole. Bellows is the picture of different regions in Vietnam.

Central Coast and the two islands near Mekong River Delta area have the best beaches ever. If you are in love with the beaches in Croatia, we would say that the beaches here will blow your mind even more. You can find also plenty of astonishing caves (e.g, S∆°n ƒêo√≤ng, Phong Nha, T√∫ L√†n) up north of the Central Coast.

As shown in the green color, Northern area and Central Highlands are places where you can find fresh air up high, mountains, and those stunning terraced rice fields.

Mekong River Delta area is best known for its floating market on the Mekong river and the plenty mangrove forests.

Ho Chi Minh city (S√†i G√≤n) is of course the heart of the Southern area. Unfortunately, the nature here is not so special. But, guess what? We have food! Moreover, affordable luxuries. Let‚Äôs think about an ‚Äúexpensive‚Äù massage at a high-end spa, a fancy cocktail on a rooftop bar with a view which is comparable with the Shard in London, or whatever you never dare to spend the money on that you can name.

So, here is the detailed list of places we recommend you visit according to our taste, experiences, and researches. We made it in four main categories [Beaches & Islands, Mountains & Caves, Mekong area, and Main Cities & More] so it is easier for you to go through the list.

Beaches & Islands

Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc/ Nam Du Island

Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc and Nam Du are close to each other so you can choose either one.

Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc is definitely more famous and has more facilities for tourist activities. There are two giant outdoor waterparks and also cable car service. It was the place where the prisoners during Vietnam war were kept. If you are more into the history part, this is the choice.

On Nam Du island, you can rent locals‚Äô houses or tents for overnight stays. Nam Du has a great nature (natural rocks, coral reefs, etc.) but there are not as many tourist activities as in Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc. In return, you can enjoy your peaceful time there.

  • Distance: About 400km away from S√†i G√≤n
Getting There

From Saigon, you have to take the bus to Ki√™n Giang at B·∫øn xe mi·ªÅn T√¢y (roughly translated Buses to the West station). After arriving Ki√™n Giang, you take the high speed boat to Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc/ Nam Du island.

There are two other routes to get to Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc.

  • By bus: S√†i G√≤n - H√† Ti√™n - Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc. Same as above.
  • By plane: There are direct flights from S√†i G√≤n to Ph√∫ Qu·ªëc Airport.

Nha Trang/ D·ªëc L·∫øt/ ƒêi·ªáp S∆°n Island

Nha Trang is EXTREMELY beautiful and popular beach in Vietnam. It is nowadays fully packed with a lot of Russian and Chinese tourists. If you want to avoid this touristic chaos, we recommend D·ªëc L·∫øt as an perfect alternative. I went there only once on a school trip and can never ever forget its beauty. While writing this post, I believe that this gem still has not been discovered by most of tourists. The evidence is that I could barely find an okay picture anywhere to show you how amazing it is. ƒêi·ªáp S∆°n island is near by and you can have a one-day trip there. Thus, check it out!

  • Distance: 481km away from S√†i G√≤n
Getting There

The best way to directly to D·ªëc L·∫øt is getting on a sleeping train to Ninh H√≤a and then get a taxi or scooter taxi to the beach.

H·∫° Long/ Lan H·∫° Bay

H·∫° Long Bay is a scenic ocean bay often included in lists of natural wonders of the world. Meanwhile, Lan H·∫° has pretty much the same nature but a lot less touristic. Its location is on the Eastern side of C√°t B√† island and on the Southern side of H·∫° Long bay.

  • Distance: 1800 km away from S√†i G√≤n
Getting There

We assume that you will slowly visit the whole country before landing on these islands. So, there are two ways to come to H·∫° Long/ Lan H·∫° from H√† N·ªôi: by bus and by train.

In case you feel like skipping other places and want to head directly to H·∫° Long from S√†i G√≤n, you can take a flight.

Mountains & Caves

ƒê√† L·∫°t

ƒê√† L·∫°t is a beautiful city in the mountains built by the French colonizers to escape the heat of Saigon. You have to try ‚ÄúB√°nh CƒÉn‚Äù once you get here.

Other than that, every street food you can find at the ƒê√† L·∫°t night market is recommeded. And, if you have the mood for some ‚ÄúAlney s be your telf‚Äù t-shirt like Thomas did, this is the place to find it.

  • Distance: 250 km away from S√†i G√≤n
Getting There

We recommend taking the sleeping bus, which takes around 6 hours to get there. If you don‚Äôt opt for the cheapest ones the bus can be quite comfortable. It‚Äôs recommended to ask how big the beds are, especially for tall people.

Sa Pa/ Y T√Ω

Terraced rice fields are the symbol of the Northern area in Vietnam. You can find them at many places. The most famous spot for tourists is definitely Sa Pa. You can do your own reaserch about this town here for more information. Mind you, the weather in the North of Vietnam is pretty cold during January. The rice fields are mostly dead at this time. The nature is of course still stunning but it might not be the same as what you have in your mind about terraced rice fields.

Close to Sa Pa is Y T√Ω, another hidden gem from Vietnam. Y T√Ω is the home of four ethnic groups of Vietnam (M√¥ng, H√† Nh√¨, Dao, and Kinh). 77,5% of the residents living here are listed as ‚Äúpoor‚Äù. It means that you might lack a lot of modern-life conveniences during your stay, such as electricity, mobilephone network, or internet, etc. But, in return, you can for sure enjoy your ‚Äúsilent‚Äù time here.

  • Distance: 2000km away from S√†i G√≤n
Getting There

You can take train or bus from H√† N·ªôi to L√†o Cai. From L√†o Cai you can take another bus to Sa Pa. There are also direct buses from H√† N·ªôi to Sa Pa which would take about 6 or 7 hours.

From Sa Pa, you can rent a scooter or go with the bus to Y T√Ω.

Mekong Delta Area

C√† Mau

You should definitely not skip the floating market on the Mekong river if you come visiting C√† Mau. There are other famous floating markets (C√°i B√®/ C√°i RƒÉng) in C·∫ßn Th∆°. However, we do think that it would save you a lot of traveling time if you go to the floating market and the mangrove forest in the same city.

Main Cities & More

S√†i G√≤n/ H√† N·ªôi

Big cities are just big cities. You won‚Äôt find any interesting nature here but in return, as we mentioned above, you can find several affordable luxuries in S√†i G√≤n and/or H√† N·ªô since they are the two largest cities in Vietnam. Besides, food is what you have to try when visit these cities. Here is the list what H√† thinks that you should definitely try at least once:

  • C∆°m t·∫•m
  • B√°nh tr√°ng tr·ªôn/ b√°nh tr√°ng cu·ªën
  • B√°nh x√®o
  • B√∫n mƒÉng v·ªãt
  • B·ªôt chi√™n
  • B√°nh cu·ªën SG
  • B√°nh canh
  • H·ªß t√≠u kh√¥
  • Ph·ªü cu·ªën
  • X√¥i
  • B√∫n ngan
  • B√∫n ·ªëc
  • Ch√°o trai/ ch√°o s∆∞·ªùn
  • B√°nh cu·ªën HN

Hu·∫ø/ ƒê√† N·∫µng/ H·ªôi An

According to Wikipedia, B√† N√† Hills, located in ƒê√† N·∫µng, is advertised as ‚Äúthe ƒê√† L·∫°t of ƒê√† N·∫µng province‚Äù. Of course, it was founded by the French colonists to be a leisure destination for (French) tourists. If it is the ƒê√† L·∫°t, what is the reasons to visit, you wondered. Yes yes, here you have beaches and BRIDGES. We don‚Äôt really understand why people go crazy for bridges so much. But, since the bridges here got recommended in several travel articles, we have to introduce them to you.

  • Distance: 960km away from S√†i G√≤n

And, because you are already in ƒê√† N·∫µng, it‚Äôs a pity if you don‚Äôt visit H·ªôi An. As it stated here, H·ªôi An is an exceptionally well-preserved example of a Southeast Asian trading port from 15th to 19th century. Every lunar month (yup, not western calendar), on the 14th, the lantern festival will take place in this town.

-Distance: 937km away from S√†i G√≤n

Hu·∫ø used to be the capital of the country. During the French Indochina, it was the administrative capital of the protectorate of Annam. If you are into good food and history, this is the place where you should visit.

  • Distance: 1043km away from S√†i G√≤n
Getting There

We recommend you to take the train to ƒê√† N·∫µng, stay there overnight, rent a scooter or take a cab to H·ªôi An, chill a bit, and go back to ƒê√† N·∫µng at the end of the day, and then take the train to Hu·∫ø. If you have tight schedule, take the flight directly to ƒê√† N·∫µng. There is also an international airport in ƒê√† N·∫µng. You can also fly to/from ƒê√† N·∫µng to/from Amsterdam.

Phnom Penh, Cambodia

Phnom Penh is the capital and largest city of Cambodia. Phnom Penh is really close to Saigon. It‚Äôs a good option if you want to make a tour around the Southern area Vietnam and other Southeast Asian countries.

  • Distance: 250 km away from Saigon.

We believe that this list gives enough information and inspiration for you to plan the trip to Vietnam. If you have any questions, ask Google! ^_^

entry.content:
Phone

The first thing you should do when you arrive in Vietnam is get a prepaid SIM card with 3G or 4G and some data. These are quite cheap and can be bought at many places. Be very careful with your phone in public places, Ho Chi Minh city is a city with 22 million (yes million) in the metropolitan area, so you can image there are some pickpockets as well.

Animals

Don‚Äôt touch any animals, even if they look cute. If you get bitten by one immediately go to a doctor to get a rabies shot.

Crossing Streets

Crossing a street may sound like a trivial task, and in most countries that‚Äôs the case. In Saigon it‚Äôs different though, there rarely are traffic lights and people don‚Äôt stop for zebra crossings. Here are some tips for crossing busy streets:

  • Walk very slow but steadily
  • Don‚Äôt make any sudden movements

Scooters

When you are adventurous enough to drive a scooter in Vietnam, especially in Ho Chi Minh city, it‚Äôs recommended to practice a bit with the traffic before throwing yourself in. Some things you can expect while driving are:

  • Ghost drivers are very common, especially right next to the sidewalk
  • Traffic lights are not common
  • Potholes pop up every couple of meters
  • People grabbing phones from your hands while driving, never hold your phone in sight, even on the back of a scooter

When you drive you have to think about yourself in the traffic more like a fish in a school of fish than an autonomous driver following the rules.

Also never drive without a helmet, it‚Äôs very unsafe and there‚Äôs a very fine for that.
